title: Authors and Citation
text: Mara Naegelin. Author, maintainer. Patrick Fonti. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Naegelin M (2025). rxs2tria: Preprocess ROXAS data TRIA. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://tria-db.github.io/rxs2tria/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rxs2tria: Preprocess ROXAS data for TRIA},   author = {Mara Naegelin},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://tria-db.github.io/rxs2tria/}, }

title: Preprocess ROXAS data for TRIA
text: goal rxs2tria prepare, quality check harmonize collection QWA images, corresponding ROXAS output files accompanying metadata submission dataset QWA database. Note: package currently development yet stable officially released. Version 1.0.0 made available organizational github.

title: Preprocess ROXAS data for TRIA
text: can install development version rxs2tria GitHub :

title: Preprocess ROXAS data for TRIA
text: Use package extract available metadata ROXAS output files given path. provide additional metadata required (e.g. site tree information, author details, …) submission dataset, can use interactive Shiny app part package. app hosted WSL server accessible via webapps.wsl.ch/QWAmeta. , want run locally, can use following command: load preprocess cell ring measurements: check coverage add ring quality flags setting years exclude:
code: library(rxs2tria)  # set input and output paths and dataset name path_in <- './path/to/ROXAS_output_data' path_out <- './out' dataset_name <- 'QWA_ex_dataset' # get overview of data to be read and extract data structure from filenames files <- get_roxas_files(path_in) str(files) # define the naming convention used for your files as a regex pattern # e.g. the following means that your filenames are structured as follows: # `{site}_{species}_{tree}_{slide}_{image}` # since there is exactly one sample (woodpiece) per tree, no woodpiece identifier is included in the pattern pattern <- "^(?<site>[:alnum:]+)_(?<species>[:alnum:]+)_(?<tree>[:alnum:].+)_(?<slide>[:alnum:]+)_(?<image>[:alnum:]+)$"  # extract the data structure from the file names using the specified pattern df_structure <- extract_data_structure(files, pattern) # read available metadata df_meta <- collect_metadata_from_files(df_structure,                                        roxas_version='classic')  # write extracted metadata to file write.csv(df_meta, file.path(path_out, paste0(dataset_name, '_meta_extracted.csv')),           row.names = FALSE) launch_metadata_app() # read raw cells/rings data QWA_data <- collect_raw_data(df_structure)  # clean raw data QWA_data <- validate_QWA_data(QWA_data, df_meta)  # remove outliers # NOTE: ROXAS does some threshold based outlier checks and assigns these a # a negative value. Here, we replace these outliers with NAs QWA_data <- remove_outliers(QWA_data)  # complete cell measures QWA_data <- complete_cell_measures(QWA_data)  # save the cleaned data to files write.csv(QWA_data$cells,           file.path(path_out, paste0(dataset_name, '_cells.csv')),           row.names = FALSE)  write.csv(QWA_data$rings,           file.path(path_out, paste0(dataset_name, '_rings.csv')),           row.names = FALSE) launch_coverage_app()  # TODO: add export functionality to coverage app

what: Check whether the data have CWT estimates — check_cwt_estimates
title: Check whether the data have CWT estimates — check_cwt_estimates
text: function checks raw data include cell wall thickness estimates, since ROXAS analyses can run without estimating CWT. generally require CWT estimates case conifer data, angiosperms. Thus images NA cwttan found, function issue warning.

title: Check whether the data have CWT estimates — check_cwt_estimates
Check whether the data have CWT estimates — check_cwt_estimates
text: df_rings_log dataframe containing rings data incl. mean_cwttan

title: Check whether the data have CWT estimates — check_cwt_estimates
text: input dataframe additional logical column 'no_cwt'

what: Check that the data are properly dated — check_dating
title: Check that the data are properly dated — check_dating
text: function checks data properly dated, .e. year variable never NA, contain values future. invalid years detected, function issue error.

title: Check that the data are properly dated — check_dating
Check that the data are properly dated — check_dating
text: df_rings_log dataframe containing rings data cell counts

title: Check that the data are properly dated — check_dating
text: input dataframe additional logical column 'undated'

what: Helper function to check if an innermost ring is incomplete — check_incomplete_innermost
title: Helper function to check if an innermost ring is incomplete — check_incomplete_innermost
text: Given dataframe cells data specific year (usually innermost one), function checks whether estimated inner ring border close 0 (.e. image border) also straight (.e. similar sides image). indicates ring cut-ROXAS used image border instead true ring border estimate MRW.

title: Helper function to check if an innermost ring is incomplete — check_incomplete_innermost
Helper function to check if an innermost ring is incomplete — check_incomplete_innermost
text: cells.innermost dataframe containing cells data innermost ring res spatial resolution image microns per pixel

title: Helper function to check if an innermost ring is incomplete — check_incomplete_innermost
text: logical indicating whether true inner ring border lies outside image border ring thus incomplete TODO: compare method GvA's original one, check thresholds

what: Complete the rings df with all years present in the cell data — complete_rings_log
title: Complete the rings df with all years present in the cell data — complete_rings_log

Create coverage plots for all trees — create_coverage_plots
text: df_rings rings dataframe save_plot plot written disk path_out path_out path plot saved.

what: Extract the data structure from input files — extract_data_structure
title: Extract the data structure from input files — extract_data_structure
text: Extract structure data (.e., images belong slide, woodpiece, tree, site) filenames input data dataframe. requires files follow labeling pattern. extracted site, species, tree, woodpiece, slide, image identifiers joined underscores derive unique codes level data structure subsequent calculations (e.g. tree_code = {site}_{species}_{tree}).

title: Extract the data structure from input files — extract_data_structure
code: extract_data_structure(   files,   pattern =     "(?<site>[:alnum:]+)_(?<species>[:alnum:]+)_(?<tree>[:alnum:][:alnum:])(?<woodpiece>[:alnum:]*)_(?<slide>[:alnum:]+)_(?<image>[:alnum:]+)",   site_label = NULL,   species_code = NULL )  get_structure_from_filenames(   filenames,   pattern =     "(?<site>[:alnum:]+)_(?<species>[:alnum:]+)_(?<tree>[:alnum:][:alnum:])(?<woodpiece>[:alnum:]*)_(?<slide>[:alnum:]+)_(?<image>[:alnum:]+)",   site_label = NULL,   species_code = NULL )

title: Extract the data structure from input files — extract_data_structure
text: files list vectors input filenames. pattern labeling pattern followed original image filenames, regex named groups. site_label Optional site code used part pattern, images site. species_code Optional species code used part pattern, images species. filenames Vector filenames processed.

title: Extract the data structure from input files — extract_data_structure
text: dataframe containing (different filenames ) data structure.

title: Extract the data structure from input files — extract_data_structure
text: default, assume files contain following pattern: {site}_{species}_{tree}{woodpiece}_{slide}_{image}, tree two-character code, woodpiece optional, suggested Fonti et al. (2025). already checked ROXAS cells, rings, settings images filenames match get_roxas_files(), ok pattern extraction image filenames . filenames identify site, species, tree, woodpiece, slide, image image file uniquely identified combination ok components present pattern, long images can uniquely identified (e.g. exactly one woodpiece extracted per tree, might specific woodpiece identifier, data site, might site identifier name). tree required components pattern site optional iff one site. case, provide site_label input parameter woodpiece, slide /image optional iff exactly one woodpiece per tree, resp. one slide per woodpiece, resp. one image per slide. species optional. Can also provided input parameter iff one species.

Extract data from a ROXAS settings file — extract_roxas_settings

title: Extract data from a ROXAS settings file — extract_roxas_settings

what: Flag duplicate rings due to overlapping images from the same woodpiece — flag_duplicate_rings
title: Flag duplicate rings due to overlapping images from the same woodpiece — flag_duplicate_rings
text: function identifies duplicate rings, .e. annual ring captured two images woodpiece due overlaps. also ranks duplicated rings number cells contain (decreasing order), since chronologies, generally want keep ring cells (rank 1).

title: Flag duplicate rings due to overlapping images from the same woodpiece — flag_duplicate_rings
Flag duplicate rings due to overlapping images from the same woodpiece — flag_duplicate_rings
text: df_rings_log dataframe containing rings data

title: Flag duplicate rings due to overlapping images from the same woodpiece — flag_duplicate_rings
text: input dataframe additional logical column 'duplicate_ring' integer column 'duplicate_sel' selected ring among duplicates

what: Flag incomplete rings at tangential image borders. — flag_incomplete_rings
title: Flag incomplete rings at tangential image borders. — flag_incomplete_rings
text: function determines inner- outermost rings image incomplete (.e. extend across image boundaries). innermost rings, rely position shape estimated inner ring border (see helper function check_incomplete_innermost). outermost rings, check MRW value, since ROXAS estimates MRW can detect outer ring boundary.
